question: How to layout isolated signal paths in control systems?
options: All signals are sent to the outside through a balanced transformer and an additional anti-interference ground channel is set up at the junction area
The isolation layer is wrapped in the middle pin through the inner and outer ring structure, and different grounding nets are matched for the upper and lower layers
Use high-impedance signal barriers and capacitive receive networks to suppress cross-noise and limit channel crosstalk intensity
The isolation side and the control side are arranged in independent areas, and the isolation chip is used at the signal crossing point and the trace is controlled to the shortest
None of the above options are correct
